metadata.title: CVE-2022-3294 kubernetes: node address isn't always verified when proxying (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in Kubernetes, where users may have access to secure endpoints in the control plane network. Kubernetes supports node proxying, which allows clients of kube-apiserver to access endpoints of a Kubelet to establish connections to Pods, retrieve container logs, and more. While Kubernetes already validates the proxying address for Nodes, a bug in the kube-apiserver made it possible to bypass this validation. Bypassing this validation allows authenticated requests destined for Nodes to redirect to the API Server through its private network. 
            STATEMENT: Kubernetes clusters are only affected if an untrusted user can modify Node objects and send requests proxying through them.
